result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominick James Michael Liptow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional.  May not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol.
Maintain employment and/or continue with education.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dominick James Michael Liptow

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: 4:14 PM Defendant Dominick James Michael Liptow in court.  Attorney Joseph Michael Freier in court for Dominick James Michael Liptow.  Attorney David S Olson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest; Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders sentence withheld, 12 months probation, any treatment deemed necessary, costs due to Clerk of Court, maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, may not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional, may not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol, maintain employment and/or continue with education, 2 days sentence credit.
